TopicTitle: [v1.3!] Silisko Industries Doughnut Research & Spacecraft Development

Articles.Content:
Nova, while you are busy renaming the parts, would you consider swapping the stats between the 2m engines. If you look at the nozzles as modeled, the orginal 2m Bertha is the biggest and the new 2m is the smallest. Would you consider making the orginal Bertha the most powerful, and the new one the least, with the twin in the middle?

PS- Thanks again for releasing your parts for us to use.

That would work but I like the model of the new one best!

That would work but I like the model of the new one best!

meh, nozzle size is not everything. I kinda like it, to be honest.

Made a new model for the bootleg command module. It really needed one.

Can you make this so we can use it as the Command Module like the C7 Aviation http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=1172.0 pack did with his mod, allowing use to change the pod. can you do that please?

PLEASE :>

Can you make this so we can use it as the Command Module

Uh.

Delete/backup the original mk1pod folder and rename this one to that?

Pretty sure that's all the one you linked does.
I already made one that replaces the default command pod. It will be released with 1.1

I already made one that replaces the default command pod. It will be released with 1.1

I tried it once, but for some reason it didnt work out well. still dont know why it didnt.

Made a 'TitanIIC' clone

I cfg edited the long 1.75m tanks into a very large SRB (400n/60sec)

[attached unless Nova asks me to remove it]

Oh, the VL-SRBs are stackable...

(but they overheat)

*notices earlier picture of a kerbal Buran*

*sigh* it's really too bad the project died witht he soviet union. The Energia was a very cool launch system.

Upcoming parts so far:

Gemini/Mercury inspired capsule, with replacement for mk1 pod.

Nano decoupler, for detaching parachutes or nosecones from the capsule.

Nano SAS, goes on top of the ship to help stabilise it more.

Unmanned control module, control pod that doesn't have to go on top of rockets, with replacement for mk1 pod.

Alternate paint job for 2m long tank.

Various N1-inspired parts.

Renamed all 2 meter parts to 1.75 meter, to better fit with sunday punch's -actual- 2 meter parts.

1.75 to 2 meter attachments.

Payload assist module, for deorbiting.

Upcoming parts so far:

Nano decoupler, for detaching parachutes or nosecones from the capsule.

Nano SAS, goes on top of the ship to help stabilise it more.

Various N1-inspired parts.

Renamed all 2 meter parts to 1.75 meter, to better fit with sunday punch's -actual- 2 meter parts.

1.75 to 2 meter attachments.

Payload assist module, for deorbiting.

Sounds good!

*sigh* it's really too bad the project died witht he soviet union. The Energia was a very cool launch system.

With the soviet union died many good things

Various N1-inspired parts.

Soviet unfinished heavy rocket? It must be cool, n1 was beautiful
Quick renders of the N1 engine:

Quick renders of the N1 engine:

My god...

Note that I'm going to go for a more Kerbal-ified version of the N1 - proportions a bit exaggerated when compared to the real life version.

Strangely, the Kerbal version is likely to be safer than the real one...

I worked up a texture for Nova's long 2m fuel tank to resemble a Titan booster (see my post above).

A couple pixels are off as I just used an old shareware program GraphicConverter and did it by eye.

Note that I'm going to go for a more Kerbal-ified version of the N1 - proportions a bit exaggerated when compared to the real life version.

Strangely, the Kerbal version is likely to be safer than the real one...

I'm looking forward to seeing that. Will the engine be sized for 3m parts, or will you create some 5m parts, which would put it about to scale with the Saturn V part set?

N1 progress:

The bottom engine is 3m, top of middle fuel tank is 1.75m, very top is 1m
Also, a note, my 1.75 meter parts are still named 2m internally. Old saved rockets will still work!
NovaSilisko, I'm not sure if this has been asked before, but do you have a planned list of parts/addons that you are looking to create? Or do you just decide to mod them 'on a whim'?

Also, a note, my 1.75 meter parts are still named 2m internally. Old saved rockets will still work!

OH THANK YOU, I was just thinking that I should ask that!

NovaSilisko, I'm not sure if this has been asked before, but do you have a planned list of parts/addons that you are looking to create? Or do you just decide to mod them 'on a whim'?

So far the most part, its safe to say it seems like it.
Pretty much done.

Nice!

Did it make it into orbit, or did it blow up halfway there?

ETA- reskinned the large liquid tank for a Titan look to go with the large solids
Wish I knew how to make parts

Pretty much done.

Looking good! Can't wait to fly it.
